citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
At the time of the inspection, the written program of veterinary care was a 7002(a) and only had the wolf hybrids listed on
it. Although dogs do require a specific written program of veterinary care, there was not another written program of
veterinary care that covered the other animals at the facility. The written program(s) of veterinary care must include all
species of animals under the care of the attending veterinarian and be complete.
Correct by: September 30, 2024

At the time of the inspection the dogs on hand form (APHIS form 7005) was missing the required information concerning
the disposition of two wolf-hybrids that are no longer located at the facility. Complete disposition information is necessary
for trace-backs and animal identification purposes. The licensee must ensure that the form 7005 is kept up-to-date and
must obtain the required information.
The regulations require the name and address of the person to whom a dog or cat was sold or given and that person's
license or registration number if he or she is licensed or registered under the act.
Correct by: September 30, 2024

At the time of the inspection, there was no inventory or animals on hand document for the animals at the facility. Complete
acquisition information is necessary for trace-backs and for identification purposes. The licensee must ensure that the
APHIS form 7019 or alternate document with all the required information is kept up-to-date and must obtain the name and
address of their animal sources at the time of acquisition.
Record of Animals on Hand (other than dogs and cats) (APHIS Form 7019) and Record of Acquisition, Disposition, or
Transport of Animals (other than dogs and cats) (APHIS Form 7020) are forms which may be used by dealers and
exhibitors to keep and maintain the information required by paragraph (b)(1) of this section concerning animals other than
dogs and cats except as provided in § 2.78.
Correct by: September 30, 2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
